Kit Number 2
However, the classroom teacher's plans must reach beyond the Tea¬
cher's Guide and the procedures it suggests. Although the classroom
teacher may largely determine the role of the televised units in his
handling of a subject in the classroom, there are several factors which
must be taken into account.
It is well to plan ahead (how far ahead depending upon the situa¬
tion and the individual teacher's preference), meshing the Teacher's
Guide with the emphases and requirements of state and local courses of
study, and considering the calendar, with its messages of special days,
of preparations to be made, of resources to be secured, of materials to
be supplied or prepared, of activities to be correlated. Marking his
calendar, making notations in the margins of the Teacher's Guide, the
classroom teacher plans for the weeks or months ahead, making the tele¬
vision lesson an integral part of classroom experience.
